label: ABC3_oP20_62_c_c_cd-002
title: NH$_{4}$NO$_{3}$ III ($G0_{10}$) Structure
comments:
Ammonium Nitrate exists in a variety of forms, (Hermann, 1937) depending on the temperature: \begin{tabular}{ccccc} \\ Phase & Temperature $^{\circ}$C & {\em Strukturbericht} & Page & \\ \hline I & 125 -- 170 & $G0_{8}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cP2_221_a_b-001}{AB\_cP2\_221\_a\_b-001} \\ II & 84 -- 125 & $G0_{9}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_tP10_100_b_a_bc-001}{ABC3\_tP10\_100\_b\_a\_bc} \\ III & 32 -- 84 & $G0_{10}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_oP20_62_c_c_cd-002}{ABC3\_oP20\_62\_c\_c\_cd-002} (this structure) \\ IV & -18 -- 32 & $G0_{11}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B2C3_oP18_59_ef_ab_ae-001}{A4B2C3\_oP18\_59\_ef\_ab\_af-001} & \\ V & $< -18$ & & \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B2C3_tP72_77_8d_ab2c2d_6d-001}{A4B2C3\_tP72\_77\_8d\_ab2c2d\_6d2-001} \end{tabular} 
 Data for this structure was taken at $46\,{^\circ}$C. 
 It is likely that the NH$_{4}$ radicals are free to rotate (Kracek, 1937).
 (Goodwin, 1947) give the structure in the $Pbnm$ setting of space group \#62.  We used FINDSYM to change this to the standard $Pnma$ setting. 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_oP20_62_c_c_cd-003}{Argonite (CaCo$_{3}$, $G0_{2}$)}, \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_oP20_62_c_c_cd-001}{$\alpha$-KNO$_{3}$}, and \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_oP20_62_c_c_cd-002}{(NH$_{4}$)NO$_{3}$ III ($G0_{10}$)} all share the same AFLOW label, ABC3\_oP20\_62\_c\_c\_cd. The structures are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files.
